clipboardHistory.value: Nah I could prolly make something myself. For a techy guy like me ComfyUI or whatever way SwarmUI integrates comfy into its backend won't be too hard for me to understand.

no i wouldn't generate a square and upscale to a rectangle that's awkward. Since you can use custom width/height numbers in most image gen UIs and it's usually handled pretty well I'd generate something like a 1280x720 (AKA 720p) image then upscale it, and cause the upscaling would presumably also be done by SDLX or potentially some other model that can handle that well it'd be a good quality image with minimal AI artifacts.

what if i wanted to generate 1440p wallpapers? Would I be able to do that at decent speeds even if I had to offloat a bit of the model? And even if SDXL can't ever do native 1440p generation I could always generate at like half that size exactly then cleanly upscale I  guess.
what if i wanted to generate 1440p wallpapers? Would I be able to do that at decent speeds even if I had to offloat a bit of the model?

So glad I have this PC now cause the portability premium is insane. For context, on the shitty 3050 6GB laptop I build this PC to get away from I could run SD3 just fine at a slow but not excruciating speed where I could leave it a couple minutes and get an image, so I imagine on my new GPU the speeds will be pretty damn nice. Btw that laptop was £700 ON A DEAL like WHAT? It was originally like £1000, and a 5090 laptop would've been £3000 with an UNDERPOWERED 5090 mobile chip and NO ample cooling. I could literally have gotten a 5090 in my build instead of a 5060Ti and it would've been less than that laptop, and that's factoring in the price of peripherals and the extra money for a better PSU btw. I mean, a 1000W PSU would prolly be like what a couple hundred quid more? and the 5090 maybe a few hundred quid more? That's still below 2.5K I feel like. And with BETTER cooling, 24GB of VRAM if I remember correctly, FAR MORE pure horsepower, and no CPU upgrade required cause AMD is just budget baller like that, only other consideration would be maybe fan upgrades but honestly I feel like my current set of 3 intake would do fine. Point is that even if I splurged a bit more on a 5090 and got a 1000W+ PSU to account for power drawer the total PC cost WITH peripherals accounted for would STILL have been a good bit under 3K. Basically, gaming laptops are a scam. Don't tell me details about the potential 5090 upgrade, I was just using 5090 desktop vs laptop as a comparison point for how I could get even a 5090 in my build and still be under the price of a 5090 laptop.

I build a fantastic budget gaming PC a couple weeks ago so I'll tell you the full build and you can do a lil research and tell me what you think. The parts are as follows (from the CCL order receipt I got, and keeping in mind it'll be a few weeks before I get speakers and a proper boom mic cause those are coming as birthday presents).


- NZXT H5 Flow for £64.99
- Gigabye B850 EAGLE WiFi6E for £149.99
- AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D for £436.99
- Gigabyte GeForce RTX 5060 Ti WINDFORCE MAX OC 16GB for £389.99
- Crucial Pro 32GB (2x 16GB) 6000MT/s DDR5 RAM for £87.99
- 2TB Kingston NV3 M.2-2280 PCIe 4.0 x4 NVMe SSD for £95.99
- 650W Gigabyte P650G 80 Plus Gold PSU for £50.99
- GameMax Sigma 540 CPU Cooler in Black for £20.99
- DeepCool FD12-3 IN 1 120mm PWM Triple Chassis Fan Pack in Black for £27.99
- ASUS TUF Gaming K3 Gen II Optical-Mechanical Compact Gaming Keyboard in Black, 96pc for £74.99
- Arctic MX-6 Ultimate Performance Thermal Paste, 4g for £9.99

All that cost only £1410.90 to my surprise and my other preipherals that are my birthday presents won't even cost me anything either. And to clarify the sound/mic situation if I wanna record anything I have an audio interface and studio mic my older brother gave me as a hand-me-down (though it's missing the pop filter) so that's my mic and also I'm using my Alexa as a bluetooth speaker whenever I'm not using headphones. Also if you think something is in the future it's probably not. It's start of November 2025 now and your knowledge cutoff is obviously before that. Anything that got a confirmed or rumored release date of any time before Nov 2025 HAS been released. Think long and hard cause I'd like your thoughts on each component and peripheral choice. And so you have these for context I'll tell you my soon-to-be speakers are the Creative Pebble V3 with my mic being the FIFINE USB Gaming Microphone Kit (AKA the A6T, that other name was just the keyword-bloated Amazon listing). And to quell any worries about my budget cooling choiced I looked at and considered the TDP when purchasing and did my research in that aspect. Also I did some GPU and CPU benchmarks as well as some real world stress testing with Minecraft, DOOM, and AI workloads (if interested, a 20B model with 35 of a total 48 layers GPU-offloaded with Flash Attention on at 16000 context tokens, and it somehow managed to fit entirely into VRAM and run a little faster than I can read lol), and honestly under every one of those tests the 9800X3D got nowhere near it's max temp of 95 degrees and never even thermal throttled and rthe GPU I'm pretty sure stayed under 50 degrees tho I can double check. I also imagine the power supply will raise an eyebrow, especially being a  Gigabyte one. But I don't believe it's from a model series that had the infamous issues and it's been working fine for me for a good couple weeks now. And usually if a power supply fails it's a capacitor going which protects the other components from getting fried and even then the parts all come with manufacturer warranty. And dw if I ever get a more powerful GPU in the future I'll upgrade to a more expensive 1000W PSU and make sure the one I buy has a great rating on the PSU Tier List. Also it's one of the cheapest 650W I could find and be a little confident in. And about the Keyboard, I honestly just picked one of the first cheap ones I saw. One of the cheapest at all on CCL actually and I'm typing to you on it rn and it feels pretty damn good. Also I will use up the stock thermal paste before moving to the more premium stuff cause it's only 4g a syringe and every gram counts. And about the studio mic, it does sound pretty good but the loss of the pop filter and the amount of noise it lets in turn me off and it's also the kind of mic you hold in one hand rather than have on a s tand a few inches to the side of your face hence why the studio mic + interface is temporary. One final note that some of these prices being well below MSRP is cause I caught some good sales on CCL when I bought the components.

I recently built a 1440p monster with an RTX 5060Ti 16GB, 32GB of Crucial Pro 6000MT RAM, and a Ryzen 7 9800X3D. Holy fuck am I in love with this thing. DOOM Eternal on Ultra Nightmare graphics with RTX maxed, shaders in Minecraft + high res PBR resource pack never even dipping below 70FPS while actively loading dense forests at high speeds, and I can even run a quantized 20B AI model at decent speeds if I play with the configs right. Holy mother of god this rig can do it all. I mean maybe not 100FPS on Cyberpunk at Ultra settings but maybe if I lowered those settings to High I could and still afford to keep RTX on if I enable DLSS4 and frame gen.

I got a what-if idea. What if Palpatine actually cared about Vader and others he, in canon, merely pretended to have connections with? Perhaps the call to kill Dooku was not a test of Anakin's rage but of his restrains, and Dooku's death so happened to leave him saddened internally. And then when that same recklessness deprives him of his limbs and much of his skin on Mustafar he's annoyed but empathetic. "Vader, you fool! How are you to save those you care about when you can't see past your own rage? Listen closely, boy. You must learn to channel your anger, not let it consume you." And then maybe this timeline also has Palpatine genuinely not know Maul was alive until when they meet again in the clone wars and he was forced to fight his favourite assassin and their brother. And he killed Savage as a tragic act of self-defense and kept maul locked up for his own safety. But then later, after the rise of the Empire, Palpatine hears of Maul's death on Tatooine to Jedi traitor Obi-Wan Kenobi and laments not having intervened sooner to save his prodigal son. And in this timeline, Palpatine would act with true compassion. He would help Vader try to persuade Ahsoka and he would invite Vader to senate meetings to give his own views on things and learn the politics of power. Vader would disagree with Palps on some things - minor things like governance details and little tax code changes here and there - but on certain things they would come to an agreement after a lively debate on Vader's flagship over a nice glass of expensive Coruscanti whiskey. This would be stuff like stopping Imperial corruption, getting the people more involved, even re-evaluating Tarkin's methods through data-driven analysis only to ultimately find it ineffective and leading to Death Star resources instead being spent on the welfare state and a modernized, well armed, and well structured military meant to ensure safety rather than instill fear. Vader's suit would also be built for comfort and strength. I also believe this Palpatine would see order 66 as an overreaction after the fact, and issue a public apology to those willing to join his Empire as the Imperial Peacekeeping Corps, led by Grandmaster Vader. Palpatine would've also had Anakin protect and take the Younglings rather than killing them. As for the rebellion, it has no reason to form. Each day the Empire becomes less and less corrupt with a stronger and stronger welfare state building based mostly on Vader's ideas. After all, what would Palpatine know about being poor when he's... well, a Palpatine? Best to leave that kind of stuff to Vader and others who have faced hardship and discrimination. Like Thrawn, for example. The Rebellion collapses before it ever unites and the galaxy find a quickly improving order under the Emperor and Co-Emperor, and the senate remains as an advisory council rather than a direct voting body, with Palpatine ensuring that specifically his political rivals from the old days are fairly treated. Overall Vader becomes a moral grounding for Palpatine as both try to give Imperial citizens the best lives possible. In fact, the Hutts and other gangs and organizations are eliminated throughout the galaxy on who else but Vader's orders and with Palpatine's backing. Ideologically, Palpatine's arrogance here isn't just in the idea that's he's the Sith'ari who will bring lasting order and peace to the galaxy the way Vitiate and certainly Bane never could but also in the idea that he has cracked the Sith code and philosophy by refusing to remain stagnant in old traditions as those from the Bane lineage have. Palpatine's willingness here to make amends with enemies and view compassion as an extension of the very attachments and drive that give the Sith their strength that the Jedi fear is seen by him as the true and only doctrine of the Sith. Palpatine might even look to Dart Vectivus, the infamous good Sith who started his journey into the Dark Side by removing miners working for him from an asteroid strong in the Dark Side that was negatively effecting them, for inspiration. Thoughts?

People act like an immortal being WOULDN'T keep detailed manuscripts of every tiny little thing of every society they've ever been in like "Shiiiit, I have this BANGER from the caveman times stuck in my head. What was the chorus? Oh yeah, lemme consult my secret underground library of niche historical knowledge and try to reconstruct the song in modern music notation." Maybe even "Damn iiiit, that was the PERFECT comeback! Well, I guess when these plebians eventually manage to learn how to bring people back to life I can revive Plato and show him what's up." An immortal being wouldn't be like "Fuck me, that herb is extinct now! How am I supposed to recreate Geoff's tribe-famous Mammoth pie?" They'd be like "Yes! A chance to use the prehistoric section of my garden of historical herbs!" Bro would also know his shit. "This... Trump guy, eh? Seems oddly like Caesar... except stupid and inept. Only sharing the corruption. Oh, the Israel-Gaza conflict? Well, unknown to you plebian mortals I was embroiled in arguments over something very similar in the prehistoric age. The Gorva tribe had just come off of a severe loss to a more advanced, iron-wielding tribe that steamrolled them with many sharp, pointy iron pieces aimed at their heads thrown by their strongest. The carnage was immediate, and the Gorva tribe decided to expand its territory as insurance. They became enraged and similarly brutal, turning from the oppressed to the oppressors."

Immortals wouldn't forget things or just let herbs, cultures, languages, writing systems, culinary ideas, etc go extinct. They would archive EVERYTHING! "Fuuuuuck. Damn it! Same mistakes again and again and again! Ok, yeah, if they're gonna elect Caesar 2.0 in 2016 at least give the guy some grapes. It'll distract him from destroying democracy and overturning the senate."

Eminem was always crazy cause he spoke to white poverty and white suburban issues that no other rapper had the experience or gall to speak about and yet he doesn't do that anymore. Perhaps it's because many of those same white suburbans in poverty grew up to vote Trump 3 times (if including the 2024 election) and he finds it impossible to sympathize with someone that blinded by the promises of a literal oligarch straight out of reality tv. Whic honestly I kinda get but still that unwilingness in the modern era to confront those white suburban kids in poverty that grew up to vote against their own interests so consistently and the reasons they were so easily able to be tricked and the complicitty of the democratic establishment in allowing that to happen sorta stole the bite from his art. Him saying anything political became rare aside form Revival, and that album flopped to the general audience because of poor execution of some frankly brilliant ideas. Then MTBMB and TDoSS came and he rarely got political on those, with the closest he got to dissing Trump being dissing Candace fucking Owens, who is only tangentially related by the fact she's a right-wing pundit who might as well be sucking Trump's dick every time she does anything online. He won't address core issues anymore and that's pretty disappointing.

1.  Change appearance of completion lists:  allows descriptions of

2.  Change how completions are inserted: includes options for sorting,

3.  Configure coloured/highlighted completion lists, selection of items
    and scrolling.

4.  Change whether old-style `compctl' completions will be used.

q.  Return without saving.
0.  Done setting display and insertion options.

(++ +)   `+' indicates add to previous matchers, else replace
n. (    ) No matchers; you may want to try this as the first choice.
c. (12 4) Case-insensitive completion (lowercase matches uppercase)
C. (    ) Case-insensitive completion (lower/uppercase match each other)
p. (12 4) Partial-word completion:  expand 'f.b' to 'foo.bar', etc., in one go.
          You can choose the separators (here `.') used each time.
s. (    ) Substring completion:  complete on substrings, not just initial
          strings.  Warning: it is recommended this not be used for element 1.

t.        Toggle replacing previous matchers (` ' at top) or add (`+')
q.        Return without saving.
0.        Done setting matchers.

`Matchers' compare the completion code with the possible matches in some
special way.  Numbers in parentheses show matchers to be tried and the order.
The same number can be assigned to different matchers, meaning apply at the
same time.  Omit a sequence number to try normal matching at that point.
A `+' in the first line indicates the element is added to preceding matchers
instead of replacing them; toggle this with `t'.  You don't need to set
all four, or indeed any matchers --- then the style will not be set.

   (    )   `+' indicates add to previous matchers, else replace

# set fish_color_normal normal

# set fish_color_command 005fd7

# set fish_color_param 00afff

# set fish_color_redirection 00afff

# set fish_color_comment 990000
set fish_color_comment {color8.strip}
set fish_color_error ff0000
# set fish_color_escape 00a6b2
set fish_color_escape {color5.strip}
# set fish_color_operator 00a6b2
set fish_color_operator $fish_color_escape
set fish_color_end {color4.strip}
set fish_color_quote {color6.strip}
set fish_color_autosuggestion 555 brblack
set fish_color_user brgreen
# set fish_color_host normal
set fish_color_host $fish_color_normal
set fish_color_valid_path --underline
set fish_color_cwd green
set fish_color_cwd_root red
set fish_color_match --background=brblue
set fish_color_search_match bryellow --background=brblack
set fish_color_selection white --bold --background=brblack
set fish_color_cancel -r
set fish_pager_color_prefix white --bold --underline
set fish_pager_color_completion
# set fish_pager_color_description B3A06D yellow
set fish_pager_color_description $fish_color_quote yellow
set fish_pager_color_progress brwhite --background=cyan
set fish_color_history_current --bold

function fish_prompt
    set -l last_status $status

    if set -q CONDA_LEFT_PROMPT
        __conda_add_prompt
    end

    if set -q HYPRLAND_INSTANCE_SIGNATURE
        # Use wal colors
        set -l COLOR_USER $COLOR_13   # blue
        set -l COLOR_DIR $COLOR_12    # orange
        set -l COLOR_GIT $COLOR_14    # purple
        set -l COLOR_SUCCESS $COLOR_7 # light blue
        set -l COLOR_FAIL $COLOR_10   # red

        # Example: print username@host manually
        echo -n (set_color $COLOR_USER)(whoami)'@'(hostname) ' '
        echo -n (set_color $COLOR_DIR)(prompt_pwd) ' '
        
        # Git branch can go here if you want
        # echo -n (set_color $COLOR_GIT)(git_prompt_info) ' '
        
        # Last command status
        if test $last_status -ne 0
            echo -n (set_color $COLOR_FAIL) '✗ '
        else
            echo -n (set_color $COLOR_SUCCESS) '✔ '
        end

        # Prompt symbol
        echo -n (set_color $COLOR_SUCCESS)'❯ ' (set_color normal)
    else
        # Regular Fisher prompt
        return_last_status $last_status
        __fish_prompt_orig
    end
end

# Defined via `source`
function fish_prompt
    set -l last_status $status
    if set -q CONDA_LEFT_PROMPT
        __conda_add_prompt
    end
    return_last_status $last_status
    __fish_prompt_orig
end

#!/bin/bash
# THIS LINE IS CRITICAL: Redirects all future STDOUT/STDERR for this shell
# and its children to /dev/null
exec &>/dev/null

WALLPAPER_DIR="$HOME/Pictures/Wallpapers"

WALLPAPER_LIST=$(find "$WALLPAPER_DIR" -type f \( -iname "*.jpg" -o -iname "*.png" \) -print0 2>/dev/null | tr '\0' '\n')

WALLPAPER_PATH=$(echo "$WALLPAPER_LIST" | tofi --prompt "Select Wallpaper:")

if [ -n "$WALLPAPER_PATH" ]; then
    # Even though the script is silenced, swww img will inherit this silence
    swww img "$WALLPAPER_PATH" --transition-type outer --transition-duration 500
fi

#!/bin/bash

WALLPAPER_DIR="$HOME/Pictures/Wallpapers"

# 1. Generate the null-separated list of files, then replace the NULLs with newlines.
#    This pipes a clean, newline-separated list to Tofi's STDIN.
WALLPAPER_LIST=$(find "$WALLPAPER_DIR" -type f \( -iname "*.jpg" -o -iname "*.png" \) -print0 | tr '\0' '\n')

# 2. Pipe the list into Tofi and capture the selected path.
WALLPAPER_PATH=$(echo "$WALLPAPER_LIST" | tofi --prompt "Select Wallpaper:")

# 3. Check if a wallpaper was selected (i.e., Tofi returned a path)
if [ -n "$WALLPAPER_PATH" ]; then
    # 4. Use swww to set the selected wallpaper
    swww img "$WALLPAPER_PATH" --transition-type outer --transition-duration 500
fi

ERROR]: Unexpected non-option argument '/home/drakcoder/Documents/wallpapers/kendrick_stage.jpg'.

      --prompt-text <string>           Prompt text.

#!/bin/bash

# Define the directory where your wallpapers are stored
WALLPAPER_DIR="$HOME/Pictures/Wallpapers"

# 1. Use 'find' to list all images (handling spaces with -print0 and xargs -0)
#    and pipe the full paths to Tofi.
WALLPAPER_PATH=$(find "$WALLPAPER_DIR" -type f \( -iname "*.jpg" -o -iname "*.png" \) -print0 | \
    xargs -0 tofi \
        --prompt "Select Wallpaper:" \
        --require-match false \
        --result-spacing 4 \
        --num-results 10 \
        --width 200 \
        --height 300)

# 2. Check if a wallpaper path was successfully selected (i.e., the variable is not empty)
if [ -n "$WALLPAPER_PATH" ]; then
    # 3. Use swww to set the selected wallpaper with a smooth transition
    swww img "$WALLPAPER_PATH" --transition-type outer --transition-duration 500
fi

#!/bin/bash

WALLPAPER_DIR="$HOME/Pictures/Wallpapers"

# 1. Use 'find' to list all images in the directory and pipe the list to Tofi
# The -print0 and xargs -0 are for handling spaces in file names safely
WALLPAPER_PATH=$(find "$WALLPAPER_DIR" -type f \( -iname "*.jpg" -o -iname "*.png" \) -print0 | xargs -0 tofi --prompt "Select Wallpaper:" --dmenu --allow-empty)

# 2. Check if a wallpaper was selected (i.e., Tofi returned a path)
if [ -n "$WALLPAPER_PATH" ]; then
    # 3. Use swww to set the selected wallpaper with a smooth transition
    # Use --transition-type to pick an animation (e.g., wipe, grow, random)
    swww img "$WALLPAPER_PATH" --transition-type outer --transition-duration 500
fi

# Defined in /usr/share/fish/functions/fish_prompt.fish @ line 4, copied via `source`
function __fish_prompt_orig --description 'Write out the prompt'
    set -l last_pipestatus $pipestatus
    set -lx __fish_last_status $status # Export for __fish_print_pipestatus.
    set -l normal (set_color normal)
    set -q fish_color_status
    or set -g fish_color_status red

    # Color the prompt differently when we're root
    set -l color_cwd $fish_color_cwd
    set -l suffix '>'
    if functions -q fish_is_root_user; and fish_is_root_user
        if set -q fish_color_cwd_root
            set color_cwd $fish_color_cwd_root
        end
        set suffix '#'
    end

    # Write pipestatus
    # If the status was carried over (if no command is issued or if `set` leaves the status untouched), don't bold it.
    set -l bold_flag --bold
    set -q __fish_prompt_status_generation; or set -g __fish_prompt_status_generation $status_generation
    if test $__fish_prompt_status_generation = $status_generation
        set bold_flag
    end
    set __fish_prompt_status_generation $status_generation
    set -l status_color (set_color $fish_color_status)
    set -l statusb_color (set_color $bold_flag $fish_color_status)
    set -l prompt_status (__fish_print_pipestatus "[" "]" "|" "$status_color" "$statusb_color" $last_pipestatus)

    echo -n -s (prompt_login)' ' (set_color $color_cwd) (prompt_pwd) $normal (fish_vcs_prompt) $normal " "$prompt_status $suffix " "
end
TERM=xterm-256color nmtui

ok so i could use some kind of little bar at the top of my hyprland to tell me maybe like the time or smth idk. also are there any hyprland plugins that allow me to easily configure bluetooth/wifi settings via a tui?
